title: Pākehā
summary: Pākehā (or Pakeha; /ˈpɑːkɛhɑː, -kiːhɑː, -kiːə/;[1]  Māori pronunciation: [ˈpaːkɛhaː]) is generally a  Māori-language term for New Zealanders primarily of European descent.[2] Pākehā is not a legal concept and has no definition under New Zealand law. The term can apply to fair-skinned persons, or to any non-Māori New Zealander.[3][4] Papa'a has a similar meaning in Cook Islands Māori.[2][5]
